table_caption: Results of different models in ASD vs. NC classification task based on rs-fMRI data in NYU, UM, and UCLA sites. The data set preceding the arrow represents the source domain, and the arrow is followed by the target domain to predict. Values are reported as mean ± standard deviation. DC: Degree centrality; BD: Feature fusion using betweenness centrality and degree centrality; BDC: Feature fusion using betweenness centrality, degree centrality, and closeness centrality; DNN: Deep neural networks; GCN: Graph convolutional networks; DNNC: Cross-domain model based on multi-layer perceptron; MMD: Maximum Mean Discrepancy; DANN: Domain Adversarial Neural Network; ACC: Accuracy; Pre: Precision; Rec: Recall; F1: F1-Score; BAC: Balanced accuracy: NPV: Negative predictive value; AUC: Area under curve. The bold values mean to highlight the experiment results.
